title: LANGUAGE BARRIER
content:
I have joined pes ec campus through cet r3 one but my kannada isnt good enough to properly communicate with others comfortably....but since ive joined in cet r3, all my classmates are kannadigas and mostly everyone speaks kannada..I feel kind of trapped now

  
what do i do? Is there any other way to find more english/hindi speaking students ?

comments.body: try to push 1st sem, 2nd sem you will be shuffled

Speak in English/Hindi with them and they'll reply u back in the same language (Maybe not Hindi but English works everytime).Just cause they speak kannada doesn't mean they don't know English/Hindi,chill out and speak out to them.

rip.

Thats why you should go out on your own as a kid, and try to speak the local language...
which section are you in?
Which section op?
still doesnt make much difference ig...
skill issue

which section dude ? 

i am north indian too, girls talked to me in english itself

if same section as me (Q) , then we will talk , if that helps
Try speaking in english, I too faced the same issue, but the people around me are so friendly.
Get ready for "how u got in through kcet da?"
lmao p13?

Don't listen to ppl saying wait till you get shuffled. Make an attempt to learn kannada and speak as much as you can. Trust me, kannadigas love people who try their level best to learn the language and they themselves will start to hangout with you.

In my experience some of the workers knew more hindi than english NGL.. 
When I asked some questions to aunties in english they gave me a confused look and just kept speaking in kannada. One of them even asked if I knew hindi rather than english
Well this is not abt rr/ec it is the same in entire Bangalore,if uk English and Hindi u will mostly have no obstacles. (except auto drivers and some small shops)

hein really? 

luckily nobody asked me that 

( i am a girl , in girls row nobody asked me this lol )
Just talk in English da
